title: Error'd: A Dark Turn
description: You may call it equity, or equinox or whatever woke term you like but you can't sugarcoat what those of us in the North know: the Southern Hemisphere is stealing the very essence of our dwindling days. Sucking out the insolation like a milkshake and slurping it all across the equator. Rage, rage against the dying of the light! Meanwhile. Steven B. reminded us of an Error'd I'm pretty sure we've seen before, but it's too dark in here to find now. "I think Microsoft need a bit more tuning on their Office365 anti-spam filters," he suggests. Â  Jan confirms that broken test-in-production data will never die. "I hope the size of the content of the package is in fact 200mm x 78mm x 61mm, as this is what I ordered." Â  Jozsef thinks the Wise fees don't add up, claiming "The email explains why they chose this amount, but it's still funny, and technically wrong." I agree it's funny but I don't see what's wrong. Is Jozsef arguing that lowering a cost by 0% is not actually lowering anything? I see his position but I consider lowering by 0% to be simply the degenerate case of lowering, just as highering a thing by 0% is a degenerate use of antonyms. Â  Karun R. thinks this form is funny, snickering "When is optional not optional ? Won't let me submit until I entered something in the field." Â  Finally Mike just keeps tilting at this old windmill: "Is encoding finally fixed in the new version? ðŸ˜‚" Â  [Advertisement] Keep all your packages and Docker containers in one place, scan for vulnerabilities, and control who can access different feeds. ProGet installs in minutes and has a powerful free version with a lot of great features that you can upgrade when ready.Learn more.

You may call it equity, or equinox or whatever woke term you like but you can't sugarcoat what those of us in the North know: the Southern Hemisphere is stealing the very essence of our dwindling days. Sucking out the insolation like a milkshake and slurping it all across the equator. Rage, rage against the dying of the light! Meanwhile. html:
by in Error'd on 2024-09-20 Edit

Lyle Seaman

networking, security infra and filesystems kernel hacker turned application programmer, SRE and engineering manager, Lyle traded tilting at windmills for viking at Vikings but couldn't catch any.

You may call it equity, or equinox or whatever woke term you like but you can't sugarcoat what those of us in the North know: the Southern Hemisphere is stealing the very essence of our dwindling days. Sucking out the insolation like a milkshake and slurping it all across the equator.
Rage, rage against the dying of the light!

Meanwhile. Steven B. reminded us of an Error'd I'm pretty sure we've seen before, but it's too dark in here to find now. "I think Microsoft need a bit more tuning on their Office365 anti-spam filters," he suggests.

Jan confirms that broken test-in-production data will never die. "I hope the size of the content of the package is in fact 200mm x 78mm x 61mm, as this is what I ordered."

Jozsef thinks the Wise fees don't add up, claiming "The email explains why they chose this amount, but it's still funny, and technically wrong." I agree it's funny but I don't see what's wrong. Is Jozsef arguing that lowering a cost by 0% is not actually lowering anything? I see his position but I consider lowering by 0% to be simply the degenerate case of lowering, just as highering a thing by 0% is a degenerate use of antonyms.

Karun R. thinks this form is funny, snickering "When is optional not optional ? Won't let me submit until I entered something in the field."

Finally Mike just keeps tilting at this old windmill: "Is encoding finally fixed in the new version? ðŸ˜‚"

[Advertisement] Keep all your packages and Docker containers in one place, scan for vulnerabilities, and control who can access different feeds. ProGet installs in minutes and has a powerful free version with a lot of great features that you can upgrade when ready.Learn more.
